events.name: I/O Extended 2017 Sofia
events.description:
Google I/O (simply I/O) is an annual developer conference held by Google in San Francisco, California. I/O showcases technical in-depth sessions focused on building web, mobile, and enterprise applications with Google and open sources such as Android, Chrome and Chrome OS, APIs, Google Web Toolkit, App Engine, and more.

We are excited to announce that GOOGLE I/O EXTENDED will happen in Sofia, Bulgaria as well. Since we would like you to get the full experience of the I/O three-day outdoor tech festival as if you were there, we are pleased to invite you on May 17th at 7:00 PM @ DataArt Bulgaria's office (28, Todor Aleksandrov Bvld.) on the 11th floor. We'll livestream the I/O event and also host several interesting sessions for you. The event features experiential learning, Google‚Äôs latest developer products, and talks from Google Product Managers & Engineers ‚Äî plus a few surprises along the way.

The schedule will be updated regularly until the event. Make sure to check back often, and opt-in to receive notifications so we can keep you informed about the latest.

events.name: GDD Europe 2017 Extended Sofia
events.description:
Google Developer Days (GDD) are global events showcasing the latest developer products and platforms from Google to help you quickly develop high quality apps, grow & retain an active user base, and tap into tools to earn more.

This year the GDD Europe is happening in Krakow, Poland on 5th & 6th of September.¬†

Instead of going there, we decided to host an extended event in Sofia showing you all the important and interesting sessions from the¬†#GDDEurope in Krakow.¬†

Stay tuned for event details (agenda & venue). :)¬†
events.how_to_find_us: The event will be happening in Musala Soft's conference hall - 5th floor of the right wing of Interpred Sofia. When you reach the floor, there will be people to guide you to the place.

events.name: GDG Sofia November Meetup
events.description:
Dear GDG Sofia community,

It's a pleasure to announce our next meetup.

We will get to know more about Kotlin with Petar Petrov.
He is a 25-year-old Android Developer of long standing. Petar graduated Filip Kutev's National School for Folk Arts but he just fell in love with programming. Over the years, he has been an active organizer & lecturer of various events & communities, such as: Programming for all, Startup Weekend Varna, Europe Code Week Varna, Developer's Beach and even GDG Varna.

We will also learn more about Analytics tools for Mobile Apps with Martin Kuvandzhiev.
Martin works as a lead iOS developer in the Bulgarian company Phyre. He has won various prestigious awards starting with first place at the NASA Space Apps Challenge, the ‚ÄòJohn Atanasov‚Äô award, the Student award from the BAIT and the IoT award from BAIT. In his professional career, he has worked for several successful startups. He is very fond of conducting talks and lectures, so you will definitely enjoy what he has to say on the last Wednesday of November. Sounds pretty cool, ha?

Join us on Nov 29th for our November meetup!

We are looking forward to seeing you all!
events.how_to_find_us: Let the people at the reception know that you are for our meetup and they will give you access to the 11th floor.

events.name: GDG meetup: Getting into the virtual reality with Google VR SDK
events.description:
‚Ä¢ What we'll do
Ljuben Vassilev has a Masters degree in Finance but he finds his calling in programming. His professional development in the field of IT begins 2 years ago at ITTalents. Soon afterwards, he pursues a career as an Android developer in Alltreco. Ljuben‚Äôs true passion, however, are VR and AR games and that‚Äôs why he initiates professional development in that sphere as a VR developer in Udacity.
He works with Unity3D and he is very passionate about sharing his experience, knowledge and skills. Join us on February 13th at 7:15 PM in IT Step Academy and learn more about getting into the virtual reality with Google VR SDK. Don‚Äôt forget to reserve your seat via our meetup page:
https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Sofia

The schedule:
1. Principles of VR
2. Optics
3. Displays
4. Tracking
5. Challenges
6. Short History of VR
7. Major VR Platforms
8. 3-DOF vs. 6-DOF
9. Key Differences Between Mobile & Desktop VR
10. VR Cameras
11. Cardboard gaze click system
12. Daydream remote control
13. Demo
14. Q & A

‚Ä¢ What to bring
Bring your thirst for knowledge and big smiles! :)

‚Ä¢ Important to know
Please reserve your seat before noon on February 13th

events.name: International Women's Day '18: BUILDING NEW HORIZONS
Google I/O Extended '18 Sofia
events.description:
Google I/O is an annual developer conference held by Google that brings together developers from around the globe for talks, hands-on learning with Google experts, and a first look at Google‚Äôs latest developer products. This year‚Äôs developer festival will be held May 8-10 at the Shoreline Amphitheatre in Mountain View, CA and we are extremely excited to announce that GOOGLE I/O EXTENDED will happen in Sofia, Bulgaria for the 6th year in a roll.

Since we'd like you to get the full experience of the I/O three-day outdoor tech festival as if you were there, we are pleased to invite you on May 8th at 7:00 PM @ DataArt Bulgaria's office (28, Todor Aleksandrov Bvld.) on the 11th floor where we'll livestream the I/O event and also host several interesting sessions for you. The event features experiential learning, Google‚Äôs latest developer products, and talks from Google Product Managers & Engineers ‚Äî plus a few surprises along the way.

The schedule will be updated regularly until the event. Make sure to check back often, and opt-in to receive notifications so we can keep you informed about the latest.

events.name: Google Developers Community Roadshow
events.description:
Join the Google Developers Community Roadshow!

This summer, the Google Developers team is touring 10 countries and 14 cities in Europe in a colorful community bus. They'll be visiting university campuses and technology parks to meet you locally and talk about our programs for developers and start-ups.

We are super excited to share that the roadshow ends on Sofia, Bulgaria.
Join us in Sofia Tech Park anytime from 12:00 till 16:00h to find out how Google supports developer communities. Learn about Google Developers Groups, Women Techmakers program and the various ways we engage with the broader developer community in Europe and around the world.

Make sure you register here:
https://events.withgoogle.com/community-roadshow-2018/

What to expect:
- Information: learn more about how Google supports developer communities around the world, from content, speakers to a global network
- Network: with other dev community organizers from Bulgaria
- Workshops: join some of our product workshops on tour (Actions on Google, Google Cloud, Machine Learning), and meet with Google teams
- Fun: live music, games and more!

Make sure you register here prior to the event:
https://events.withgoogle.com/community-roadshow-2018/

See you there! :)
events.how_to_find_us: Look for the awesome community bus

events.name: Introduction to Machine Learning with Tensorflow
events.description:
Workshop led by Oleksandr Zakharchuk, Google Devlopers Expert
To attend the workshop, register here:
https://goo.gl/YmhetU

This session is a quick tour of the machine learning basics. We will try our hand at classifying images from Fashion MNIST dataset using TensorFlow. The tasks will be performed in Collaboratory (colab.research.google.com). The only prerequisite for this session is ability to write and understand Python code.
Please don‚Äôt forget to bring your laptop!

events.name: Practical Machine Learning with Tensorflow
events.description:
Workshop led by Oleksandr Zakharchuk, Google Devlopers Expert
To attend the workshop, register here:
https://goo.gl/YmhetU

In this session, we‚Äôll cover some of the practical aspects of using ML in startups. The topics will include using pre-trained models and transfer learning. You must know the basic ML concepts in order to benefit from this workshop. We advise you to go through the online Machine Crash Course if you have no prior experience with machine learning. The tasks will be performed in Collaboratory (colab.research.google.com).
Please don‚Äôt forget to bring your laptop!

events.name: Drive your web app with tests

venue.name: TechHuddle
venue.address_1: Business Center ESTE, Block 9, 28I Samokov Str, 1113 g.k. Iztok, Sofia

events.description:
Summer is finally here but we are already cooking some interesting events for the autumn. We are delighted to announce that our next GDG meetup is going to happen on September 13th at 7:00 PM @ TechHuddle (Business center ESTE)

What to expect:
- Why should we try TDD
- Using testing frameworks
- Challenges with writing tests properly

Who is the speaker:
Slavcho Slavchev is a web developer with a bachelor degree in journalism who found his true passion in programming. He likes playing with various technologies and tools, as well as exploring new languages. Slavcho works for a UK-based company called Holiday Extras as a NodeJS developer and in his free time he mostly reads or works on his toy projects. How cool, ha?

Special thanks to our partners TechHuddle for making this event possible and hosting you, our lovely community!

events.name: Learn how to do Firebase(d) Magic
events.description:
GDG friends, we are no Hogwarts but we are extremely excited that the Firebase team will be visiting our GDG community after the Firebase Summit happening this October in Prague.
Moreover, we are one of the 45 selected GDGs from 25 countries in Europe, so that‚Äôs what makes this event even more magical.

What to expect?
Well, to learn how to do magic with Firebase, of course.

Speakers:
Jumana Al Hashal, Product manager @ Google
Jumana is a product manager at Google. She leads Firebase Predictions, a machine-learning service providing smart user segmentation for mobile games and apps. Before joining Google, she led mobile products at Zillow. Jumana loves helping developers grow their apps and build delightful experiences for their users. She enjoys games (making them and playing them), scuba diving, and prickly machine learning problems. Jumana holds a master's degree from the University of Washington.

Benjamin Ferrari-Church, User Experience Researcher @ Google
User researcher with a demonstrated history of working with product and engineering teams.Experienced in all phases of the product development lifecycle from foundational research to summative usability. Passionate about developing user empathy across organizations.

Date & Time:
November 9th, 19:00h.

Location:
FMI (Faculty of Mathematics & Informatics, Sofia University)
–ó–ê–õ–ê ‚Ññ325

Entry:
Free of charge, but MANDATORY RSVP-ing via Meetup.

Get social:
Meetup: https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Sofia/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SofiaGoogleDevelopmentGroup/
G+: https://plus.google.com/+Gdgsofia

events.name: DevFest 2018 Sofia
events.description:
GDG Sofia is excited to announce that we are organizing the very first GDG DevFest in Bulgaria this year.

What is a DevFest?
GDG DevFests are large, community-run developer events happening around the globe, focused on community building and learning about Google technologies.
They cover multiple product areas such as Android, Firebase, Google Cloud Platform, Google Assistant, Flutter, machine learning with TensorFlow, and Mobile Web.

Each DevFest is inspired by and uniquely tailored to the needs of the developer community that hosts it. That‚Äôs why the first GDG DevFest Bulgaria will cover topics around Web, Mobile and Cloud technologies.

What to expect?
As an attendee, you can expect speaker sessions, codelabs, study jams, training sessions, workshops and more. The sessions will be led by Google Developer Experts (GDEs), Google employees and other world-renown experts.

Organizers:
GDG Sofia & WTM Sofia
TechHuddle, Qualifast Ltd. & DataArt Bulgaria

Special thanks to our partners as well:
HyperScience, Mobisystems, Holiday Extra,
SBTech,
Accedia and HRS

Speakers: https://devfest.bg/speakers/
- Selen Basol, Tech Lead Manager @ Google
- Ignacy Kowalczyk, Software Engineering Manager @ Google
- Iiro Krankka, Kotlin Google Developer Expert
- Elaine Dias Batista, Google Assistant Developer Expert
- Laura Morinigo, Firebase Google Developer Expert
- Randy Gupta, Google Cloud Developer Expert
- Peter Perlepes, GDG Athens
- Boris Strandjev, GDG & WTM Sofia organizer & CEO @ Qualifast Ltd.
- Daniel Balchev, ML Dev @ HyperScience
- Borislav Pantaleev, Full Stack Web Dev @ Mobisystems
- Angel Georgiev, Tech Training Lead @ Musala Soft
- Philip Yankov, Founder @ x8academy
- Vladislav Donchev, Software Engineer & Tutor @ IT Step Academy

Schedule: https://devfest.bg/schedule/
Topics around:
- Google Cloud: Microservices with Kubernetes and Istio
- PWA applications
- Google Optimize
- Firebase Web
- Flutter
- Actions on Google
- Google Assistant - App Actions
- Build a Slack bot (with Node.js on Kubernetes)

Location: National Palace of Culture (NDK), Hall 6
When: November 24th 2018

Tickets: On sale now -> http://bit.ly/DevFestSofia

What is a GDG?
GDG Sofia is –∞ group of enthusiasts that gather around Google technologies. We organize different events - seminars, conferences or just dine outs, and discuss the latests developments.

Disclaimer: GDG Sofia is an independent group; our activities and the opinions expressed here should in no way be linked to Google, the corporation. To learn more about the GDG program, visit https://developers.google.com/groups/

events.name: Flutter Live & Meetup
events.description:
Our GDG community is one of the many that will be hosting a viewing party next week, so don't miss it. Join us for Flutter Live on December 4th to experience the latest from Flutter, Google‚Äôs free and open source SDK for building high-quality native iOS and Android apps from a single codebase. Presented from the Science Museum in London, Flutter Live is a global celebration of Flutter. With viewing parties around the world and streaming live from the venue, we've designed Flutter Live to be a great event wherever you are.

Topic:
Start to Flutter

Speaker:
Vassil Angelov, Mobile Dev Lead @ Qualifast Ltd.

Senior Mobile Developer with expertise in designing software architecture and leading Mobile development teams to produce high quality applications. He is a strong problem solver, a fast learner, he has client-focused approach to work and communicates quickly and effectively. As a cross-functional and collaborative team member, he works diligently until the clients are fully satisfied with the end product.

Join us next Tuesday at 6:00 P.M. on bul. Todor Aleksandrov 28, 11th floor (DataArt Bulgaria).

Expect more details soon enough and don't forget to reserve your seat via Meetup!
https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Sofia/events/256746482
events.how_to_find_us: Just say at the reception that you are attending the event on the 11th floor

events.name: GDG Sofia Organizers Meetup
events.description:
GDG-ers,

We are delighted to start 2019's meetups with an open discussion regarding the kind of content you'd wish to have MORE OF throughout this year.
We initially thought of creating polls and surveys but the best thing about having such an amazing community like GDG Sofia is the honest feedback and face-to-face communication that we are all big fans of.(Especially when there's beer :)

We will also be sharing what it takes to be Google Developers Group organizer, so don't miss it and let's get together!

We are starting next Tuesday (26/02) at 19:00 h. @ Work & Share Coworking Space!

RSVP via Meetup is still mandatory, though.
See you there!

events.name: New Generation Angular Rendering and Tooling
events.description:
In collaboration with the most active JS communities in Bulgaria -
SofiaJS and JSTalks:

In April, one of the most well known Bulgarian IT experts Minko Gechev, Senior Engineer @ Google, founder of BeerJS will be again in Bulgaria and we are extremely happy that he will be able to make a presentation about the latest functionalities in Angular on which he works.
The event will be held in room 325 at FMI.

Agenda:
6:30PM - 7:00PM : Welcome and handshaking
7:00PM - 9:00PM : Presentation: New Generation Angular Rendering and Tooling by Minko Gechev

We're all looking forward to seeing you there.

events.name: IWD '19 | Balance for Better
events.description:
The Women Techmakers global event series celebrating International Women's Day is coming to Bulgaria for the second time!

Our collective of the biggest women-in-tech communities ( Women Techmakers Sofia, Women Who Code - Sofia, Coding Girls Sofia, Rails Girls Sofia & Bulgarian Centre of Women in Technology - BCWT) together with GDG Sofia are uniting once again to bring valuable content, both technical and inspirational for the second IWD mini-conference happening in Sofia. So, it‚Äôs our greatest pleasure to announce that IWD ‚Äô19 | Balance for Better will happen on April 18th at 6:00 PM at Leanplum Product Development.

Our WHY
From Ada Lovelace to Grace Hopper (and thousands of women coders), we're proud of the contributions women in technology make across the industry! Having a diversity of perspectives and ideas leads to better decision-making, more relevant products, and makes the industry much more interesting. We believe that by creating the right environments, programs and opportunities, women in tech are better positioned to drive transformational change in the industry and beyond.

What to expect?
In the span 3 hours we‚Äôll try to provide you with BOTH TECHNICAL and MOTIVATIONAL content. We are actively working on the agenda as we‚Äôve taken into consideration last year‚Äôs (IWD ‚Äô18: Building New Horizons) feedback,
so expect further details and speaker announcements soon enough!

Free registrations via either one of our Meetup communities:
https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Sofia/
https://www.meetup.com/Women-Techmakers-Sofia/

events.name: I/O Extended 2019 Sofia
events.description:
Google I/O (simply I/O) is an annual developer conference held by Google in San Francisco, California. I/O showcases technical in-depth sessions focused on building web, mobile, and enterprise applications with Google and open sources such as Android, Chrome and Chrome OS, APIs, Google Web Toolkit, App Engine, and more.

We will be hosting a watch party of the I/O event but we will start with a technical session.

We start at 19:00 h. on May 7th at Work & Share Co-working Space!

Reserve your seats and stay tuned for the speaker announcements! :)

events.name: Android functional testing made easy with Kotlin
events.description:
Hey group, one of our organisers - Boris will have a talk dedicated to Android functional testing and how to make it easy. We are very excited to co-host this event with the team of Hopper!

What do we use for Android testing at Hopper?
How do we cover functional testing at Hopper?
How to refactor an app with millions of users and keep them happy?

Come to the tech talk, and you'll find the answers to these questions and many more!

-----------

Boris chose the Android side of mobile dev seven years ago. He has been part of the development of dozens of applications and has also architected Android automation test framework that was later open-sourced. He is now part of the team of multi-million Hopper flight booking app where is reviving his test automation knowledge and putting it in good use. Many of you have already seen him in the numerous conferences/sessions he has lead. Feel invited to enjoy another evening together.

events.name: GDG DevFest Sofia 2019
events.description:
GDG DevFests are community-led, developer events hosted by GDG chapters around the globe focused on community building and learning about Google‚Äôs technologies. Each DevFest is inspired by and uniquely tailored to the needs of the developer community and region that hosts it. While no two DevFests will be exactly alike, each at its core is powered by a shared belief that when developers come together to exchange ideas, amazing things can happen.

After bringing together over 300 participants with 14 outstanding speakers from all over the world, we couldn‚Äôt wait to organize the second DevFest Sofia this year.

Soon there will be early birds available as well as speakers and agenda announcements.

RSVP via Meetup and stay tuned!

More details and tickets you can find soon enough @ https://devfest.bg/
events.how_to_find_us: Through Entrance A4 to the 5th floor (Halls 7 & 9)

events.name: GDG Sofia Study Jams & Codelabs 1.0
events.description:
We are excited to take part in #CodeWeekEU this year and that's why we decided to organize some last-minute workshops and be a part of the wave.
Here's what you can expect on Saturday (19/10) at Work & Share Co-working space (15-17, Tintyava Str., 1113, Sofia).

11:00 - Opening
11:15 - Building Beautiful UIs with Flutter
In this codelab we will use Flutter to get started building beautiful apps, with its rich set of Material Design and Cupertino (iOS) widgets and behaviors. Your users will love your app‚Äôs natural look and feel, because Flutter implements platform-specific scrolling, navigational patterns, fonts, and more. You‚Äôll feel powerful and productive with Flutter‚Äôs functional-reactive framework and our extremely fast hot reloads on devices and emulators. (edited)
13:30 - Lunch [Beer & Pizza]
14:30 - Firebase Web Codelab
In this codelab, you‚Äôll learn how to use Firebase to easily create web applications by implementing and deploying a chat client using Firebase products and services.
What you‚Äôll learn:
Sync data using Cloud Firestore and Cloud Storage for Firebase.
Authenticate your users using Firebase Auth.
Deploy your web app on Firebase Hosting.
Send notifications with Firebase Cloud Messaging.
Collect your web app‚Äôs performance data
15:30 - Closing & Networking

All you need to do is bring the essentials (laptop & coder passion) and register for free by filling this form:
https://forms.gle/5q723x1rAzMi7YJYA

About the lecturer:
Tom Mladenov, Engineering Lead & GDG Sofia organizer
As an engineering lead for web projects, he spends most of his 9-5 time working with Angular. Apart from that he reads, experiments, teaches and spreads the word for other exciting technologies such as Flutter, Kotlin, Go, Firebase and Google Cloud Platform. Outside the office, he prays for deep snow, a waxed snowboard and a working lift.

About GDG Sofia:
GDG Sofia prides itself on being an inclusive environment. Everyone and anyone interested in tech - from beginner developers to experienced professionals - are welcome to join. We are –∞ group of enthusiasts that gather around Google technologies. Founded back in 2012, we organize various events - seminars, conferences or just community dine outs, and discuss the latest Google developments. With over 40 events since then and nearly 1000 community members, we aspire to bring quality new content to the Bulgarian IT community.

Follow us:
https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Sofia/
https://www.facebook.com/SofiaGoogleDevelopmentGroup/
https://twitter.com/gdg_sofia

events.name: Flutter Interact & Managing State in Flutter
events.description:
Dear community,

We will be hosting our last meetup for 2019 on December 12th at Vertigo Business Tower (Bul. Bulgaria 109), floor 15th.

What to expect:
> "Flutter Interact"
We'll host a viewing party of the coolest stuff that will be discussed during the international event. Flutter Interact is a day-long event where the Google Developers team will showcase the latest from Flutter and focus on creating beautiful experiences across devices. Flutter product and engineering teams will gather with the wider community to create and collaborate on innovative design, share the latest news and updates, and answer your questions.

> "Managing State in Flutter" a session delivered by Tom Mladenov
As you explore Flutter, there comes a time when you need to share application state between screens, across your app. There are many approaches that you can take and if you‚Äôre coming to Flutter from an imperative framework (such as Android SDK or iOS UIKit), many of the assumptions that you might have, don‚Äôt apply to Flutter. Tommy will help us start thinking about app development from a new perspective.

- Networking Pizza & Beer provided by Devexperts Bulgaria

RSVP via Meetup and join us for that Flutter overdose! ;)
events.how_to_find_us: Please tell that you are joining an event on the 15th floor at the reception, when entering Vertigo Business Tower

upcoming.name: DevFest Bulgaria 2020
upcoming.description:
DevFest is the biggest Google Developers Group event happening around the globe, focused on community building and learning about Google technologies.

Each DevFest is inspired by and uniquely tailored to the needs of the developer community and region that hosts it. While no two DevFests will be exactly alike, each at its core is powered by a shared belief that when developers come together to exchange ideas, amazing things can happen.

More details coming in 2020 @ https://devfest.bg/
Stay tuned and join us on Meetup.com @
https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Sofia/
